Key Match Events: Kane Williamson scored a maiden World Cup half-century from 43 balls
Mitchell hit a six and two fours to bring the RRR under four
Daryl Mitchell scored his eighth ODI fifty from 43 balls
Glenn Phillips took 3 wickets in 5.1 overs
Trent Boult took 1 wicket in his first over
Lockie Ferguson took 3 wickets in 4 overs
Pre-Game Insights: Kane Williamson was doubtful for the match due to an ACL injury but returned to the lineup
New Zealand won with 8 wickets and 43 balls remaining
Bangladesh needed a strong performance to bounce back after their loss to England
Post-Match Reflections: Daryl Mitchell's aggressive batting sealed the victory for New Zealand
Kane Williamson's return to form was crucial for New Zealand's chase
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mitchell scored 78 runs off 107 balls for New Zealand
New Zealand chased down the target with 8 wickets and 43 balls remaining
